page.title: 11 THE RIVER BLACKWATER
page.content: The River Blackwater estuary from Bradwell to Maldon is 2 km wide and 16km long. The Blackwater is supposed to be the saltiest river in Britain.There is a saltworks on the river which produces the famous Maldon sea-salt. Maldon used to be a good fishing port but the fish have gone for some reason.Either the river was too polluted or the fish just moved out for some unknown reason. The Blackwater is now used mainly for leisure. The river is long and sheltered and it only takes a couple of hours to get down from London.There are a number of Yacht Clubs and some Londoners keep their own boats on the river or the canal.There are also cottages and boats available for hire. by Nicholas Hastings
